title: Mirels' Criteria for Prophylactic Fixation
description: Predicts risk of pathologic fracture in patients with long bone metastasis to guide prophylactic fixation decisions

parameters.name: site_of_lesion
parameters.description: Location of the metastatic lesion within the long bone

parameters.name: size_of_lesion
parameters.description: Size of lesion relative to bone diameter on plain radiographs

parameters.name: nature_of_lesion
parameters.description: Radiographic appearance of the metastatic lesion

parameters.name: pain
parameters.description: Level of pain related to the lesion

result.name: mirels_score
result.description: Total Mirels score predicting pathologic fracture risk

ranges.interpretation: Safe to irradiate with minimal risk of fracture. Clinical management and radiotherapy appropriate. Prophylactic fixation not indicated.
Consider prophylactic fixation based on clinical judgment. Treatment decision should incorporate patient-specific factors including functional status, life expectancy, and treatment goals.
Prophylactic fixation indicated prior to irradiation. High risk of pathologic fracture warrants surgical intervention to prevent fracture and maintain function.

references: Mirels H. Metastatic disease in long bones. A proposed scoring system for diagnosing impending pathologic fractures. Clin Orthop Relat Res. 1989 Dec;(249):256-64.

Van der Linden YM, Dijkstra PD, Kroon HM, Lok JJ, Noordijk EM, Leer JW, et al. Comparative analysis of risk factors for pathological fracture with femoral metastases. J Bone Joint Surg Br. 2004 May;86(4):566-73.

Nazarian A, Entezari V, Villa-Camacho JC, Zurakowski D, Snyder BD. Treatment planning and fracture prediction in patients with skeletal metastasis with CT-based rigidity analysis. Clin Cancer Res. 2014 May 1;20(9):2465-73. doi: 10.1158/1078-0432.CCR-13-2966.
Evans AR, Bottros J, Grant W, Chen BY, Damron TA. Mirels' rating for humerus lesions is both reproducible and valid. Clin Orthop Relat Res. 2008 Jun;466(6):1279-84. doi: 10.1007/s11999-008-0200-0.
formula: Sum of points: Site (1-3) + Size (1-3) + Nature (1-3) + Pain (1-3) = Total (4-12 points)
notes: Applies only to long bone metastases (not spine, pelvis, or ribs)
Predicts fracture risk at 6 months post-irradiation
Upper limb lesions may benefit from lower threshold (â‰¥7 points) for prophylactic fixation
Consider patient-specific factors: life expectancy, functional status, surgical risk
High-quality imaging (CT/MRI) may provide additional information beyond plain radiographs
Serial assessment may be needed for lesions receiving non-surgical treatment
